itemDescription: Welsh organic chemist and academic administrator

wikipedia_page.main: Sir Ewart Ray Herbert Jones FRS (16 March 1911 – 7 May 2002) was a Welsh organic chemist and academic administrator, whose fields of expertise led him to discoveries into the chemistry of natural products, mainly steroids, terpenes and vitamins.  His work also led to the creation of the Jones oxidation.

response: *7 May - Sir Ewart Jones, organic chemist and academic administrator, 91

* Prof Harold Henbest, Professor of Organic Chemistry from 1958 to 1973 at Queen's University Belfast, who discovered the link between retinol and Vitamin A, and worked with Sir Ewart Jones to synthesize cortisone
